summary: This appears to be a brief email or note regarding the status of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It mentions he is being kept on a certain status over the weekend and will likely be moved to the SHU (Special Housing Unit) afterward. It also includes a thank you for printing documents and seeing Epstein, and a personal inquiry about the recipient's mother.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence; the individual being kept on a certain status and seen at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: AW SS
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the author spoke with regarding the decision to keep Epstein on a certain status throughout the weekend.

connections.description: AW SS was consulted regarding the custodial status and management of inmate Jeffrey Epstein over the weekend.

events.title: Status Decision for Epstein
events.description: A decision was made to keep Jeffrey Epstein on a certain status throughout the weekend of July 25-28, 2019, with a plan to transition him to the SHU (Special Housing Unit) afterward.

locations.address: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The federal prison facility where Jeffrey Epstein was being held at the time of this correspondence.

keyFacts: As of July 25, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
A decision was made to keep Epstein on a specific custodial status over the weekend, with plans to move him to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) afterward.
The communication suggests coordination between the author, an individual identified as 'AW SS', and a legal department regarding Epstein's status.
The document is a piece of internal correspondence that includes both operational details about an inmate and a personal note.
